intro: Lippia chrysantha, commonly known as golden lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, citrus-like fragrance. Lippia chrysantha is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
